articles.title: Best of Late Night: Fallon Says Trump Might Be More of a ‘Dog’ Than Omarosa Manigault Newman
articles.author: GIOVANNI RUSSONELLO
articles.description: After President Trump called his former aide Omarosa Manigault Newman a “dog,” Jimmy Fallon said: “Everyone in the White House feels like a dog, because one year with Trump feels like seven.”

articles.title: Trump Escalates Attack on Sessions, Calling Him ‘Scared Stiff’
articles.author: MAGGIE HABERMAN
articles.description: President Trump hosting members of the New Jersey chapter of Bikers for Trump at his golf club in Bedminster. Motorcyclists in the United States tend to cover a demographic that includes a bulk of the president’s base, predominantly working-class men over 50 …

articles.title: Let’s Not Throw the Word Treason Around
articles.author: CHRISTOPHER BUSKIRK
articles.description: President Trump received a warm welcome on Saturday when he arrived for a rally at Olentangy Orange High School in Lewis Center, Ohio.

articles.title: What if Mother Nature Is on the Ballot in 2020?
articles.author: THOMAS L. FRIEDMAN
articles.description: Democrats could have a strong issue to run on if the extreme weather persists and President Trump continues to dismiss climate change.

articles.title: Melania Trump’s Parents Become U.S. Citizens as Lawyer Acknowledges ‘Chain Migration’
articles.author: ANNIE CORREAL and EMILY COCHRANE
articles.description: Viktor and Amalija Knavs had a private naturalization ceremony in Lower Manhattan, after being sponsored by their daughter in a program President Trump has railed against.

articles.title: Best of Late Night: Colbert Isn’t Surprised by Anything Omarosa Manigault Newman Says
articles.author: GIOVANNI RUSSONELLO
articles.description: “Finally, we have proof that the guy who refused to rent to black tenants” is a racist, Stephen Colbert said, referring sarcastically to President Trump.

articles.title: Before White Supremacists’ Rally, Trump Declines to Condemn Them Specifically
articles.author: NOAH WEILAND
articles.description: White nationalists clashing with counterdemonstrators in Charlottesville, Va., last year. With an anniversary rally planned in Washington on Sunday, the authorities have planned for weeks to avoid a repeat of last year’s clashes.

articles.title: Space Force, Trump, Yemen: Your Thursday Evening Briefing
articles.author: JOUMANA KHATIB and MARCUS PAYADUE
articles.description: Here’s what you need to know at the end of the day.

articles.title: Roger Stone Associate Is Subpoenaed in Russia Investigation
articles.author: ALAN FEUER
articles.description: Randy Credico, a New York radio personality, has been identified as the intermediary between Roger J. Stone Jr., a veteran adviser to President Trump, and Julian Assange, the founder of WikiLeaks.

articles.title: Trump Claims Power to Bypass Limits Set by Congress in Defense Bill
articles.author: CHARLIE SAVAGE
articles.description: In the latest example of his broad vision of executive power, President Trump used a signing statement to challenge dozens of provisions, including limits on Russia and North Korea.

articles.title: 11 of Our Best Weekend Reads
articles.author: KALY SOTO
articles.description: Don’t ask Paul Ryan about President Trump anymore. How two cyclists lost their lives in Tajikistan. We’re not prepared for global warming. Why the songs of summer sound the same. And more.

articles.title: Wisconsin Faces a Political Crossroads Tuesday. Which Way Will It Go?
articles.author: MONICA DAVEY
articles.description: Wisconsin has been in the throes of a political identity crisis for years, one exacerbated by Donald J. Trump’s surprise win in the state in 2016. From cities to rural areas like Reedsburg, the state faces a defining moment in the 2018 midterm elections, star…

articles.title: Welcome to the Resistance, Omarosa
articles.author: MICHELLE GOLDBERG
articles.description: Omarosa Manigault Newman has useful knowledge of our ruling clique.

articles.title: Primary Elections, Catholic Church, Turkey: Your Wednesday Briefing
articles.author: CHRIS STANFORD
articles.description: Ilhan Omar, center, is poised to be one of the first Muslim women elected to Congress, after winning the Democratic nomination in a left-leaning district of Minnesota.

articles.title: U.S. Officials Scrambled Behind the Scenes to Shield NATO Deal From Trump
articles.author: HELENE COOPER and JULIAN E. BARNES
articles.description: John R. Bolton, the national security adviser, pushed NATO ambassadors to finish a critical policy document before the alliance’s summit meeting last month so the president could not reject it.

articles.title: New York Congressman Chris Collins Is Charged With Insider Trading
articles.description: Representative Collins, one of President Trump’s earliest and most vocal supporters, is accused of using inside information about a new drug to avoid losses.

articles.title: In Kansas, Another Close Race, as Kobach and Colyer Remain Deadlocked
articles.author: MITCH SMITH
articles.description: After a long night of waiting for results, Kansas gubernatorial candidate Kris Kobach, with his wife, Heather, told supporters the election was too close to call early Wednesday.

articles.title: Best of Late Night: Trevor Noah Wonders if Paul Manafort Is Secretly Proud of Rick Gates
articles.author: GIOVANNI RUSSONELLO
articles.description: “This is hilarious,” Trevor Noah said of Rick Gates’s testimony against his former boss, Paul Manafort. “He’s confessing to stealing from the same guy that he was committing crimes with.”

articles.title: Kansas and Ohio Races Remain Too Close to Call
articles.author: MITCH SMITH and JONATHAN MARTIN
articles.description: In the Kansas Republican primary race for governor, Kris W. Kobach was ahead of Gov. Jeff Colyer by just 191 votes with all precincts reporting on Wednesday morning.

articles.title: Climate Fwd:: Why the Arctic Needs Mosquitoes
articles.author: KENDRA PIERRE-LOUIS, CORAL DAVENPORT and TRYGGVI ADALBJORNSSON
articles.description: In this week's newsletter, we've got a bit about everyone's favorite summer pest, and about Trump’s plan to freeze standards on automobile pollution.
